alert.note: Alert for Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:05PM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. For the Sandusky River...including Fremont, Upper Sandusky, Tiffin, Bucyrus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandusky River At Tiffin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Lowland flooding occurs north and south of the floodwall in Tiffin. Coe Street, Water Street, East Davis Street, and riverside property along Front Street are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 12/01/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM EST.
